title: Implements roles functionality to write logs to file and set log level
body:
closes #677

introduces improved logging capabilities across multiple components, providing more flexibility and control over log output. Key updates include:

* **Configurable Log Levels**
  Users can now set the verbosity of logs using levels such as `debug`, `info`, `warn`, and `error`.

* **Optional Log File Output**
  Logs can optionally be written to a file via the `-f` flag, in addition to standard output (`stdout`), supporting better log persistence and analysis.

* **Verbose Mode**
  When `-v` is used in combination with `-f`, logs are written to both `stdout` and the specified log file.

These enhancements do **not** affect the existing "Getting Started" tutorial or existing default behavior.

### Example Usage

```bash
cargo run -- --config config-examples/pool-config-local-tp-example.toml -v -f pool.log --log-level debug
```

This will:

* Write logs to both `stdout` and `pool.log`
* Set the log level to `DEBUG`

### Default Behavior

* **Log Level:**
  Defaults to `INFO` if no level is specified or if an invalid level is provided.

* **Log Output:**
  If `-f` is not set, logs are printed only to `stdout`.

* **Verbose Mode (`-v`):**
  Requires `-f` to be set. When used, logs are written to both `stdout` and the specified file.

* **No Flags Provided:**
  If none of the new flags are used, behavior remains unchanged: logs are printed to `stdout` at `INFO` level, maintaining compatibility with existing usage and tutorials.

title: Refactor sv1 connection
body: While implementing the new TProxy, we recently encountered an issue where the SV1 connection was panicking. This PR aims to improve the SV1 connection module with better structure and enhanced error handling.

title: decouple job state from channels with JobStore
body:
Currently, the channels structs manage jobs internally. This proposal decoubles job state from channels by utilizing a `JobStore` trait instead of using the job maps directly. A `DefaultJobStore` is also introduced that mirrors the 1-to-1 channel-to-jobstate architecture that is currently provided.

The overall goal of this proposal is to allow for more customizability (ie supporting a wider range of architectures potentially warranted by the end developer)

title: re-introduce dedicated function to deserialize outputs from `NewTemplate` message
body:
as the outcome of https://github.com/Sjors/bitcoin/issues/92

---

to be merged after #1775

---

in https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/pull/1772 we realized that `deserialize_outputs` was introducing issues into the code

that's because this function can only deserialize outputs that were serialized into an opaque blob, not following Bitcoin consensus rules (setting a `VarInt` prefix as the size of the array, followed by the serialized bytes... or in other words, `rust-bitcoin` serializing a `Vec<TxOut>`)

this function was being used to deserialize outputs from `SetCustomMiningJob`, which are serialized under Bitcoin consensus rules (`Vec<TxOut>`)

`NewTemplate.coinbase_tx_outputs` however follows a different rule, where `NewTemplate.coinbase_tx_outputs_count` carries the size of the array, and `NewTemplate.coinbase_tx_outputs` simply has the raw bytes (no `VarInt` prefix to indicate the size of the array)

in other words, `NewTemplate.coinbase_tx_outputs` MUST NOT be deserialized via `Vec::<TxOut>::consensus_decode`, and it needs a dedicated function to do so

but `SetCustomMiningJob.coinbase_tx_outpus` MUST be deserialized via `Vec::<TxOut>::consensus_decode` (and this is what was causing problems on #1771)

title: deprecate `mining_proxy_sv2` and related modules of `roles_logic_sv2`
body:
the original motivation of this PR was #1466 

as described on this issue, the entire `roles_logic_sv2::common_properties` module felt somewhat redundant, since most of its meaningful usage happened inside `mining_proxy_sv2` crate, which we've been considering deprecation https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/discussions/1643

in fact, not only this module, but also `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::proxy_group_channel` and `roles_logic_sv2::job_dispatcher` and a significant portion of `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory`

so I went ahead with a more practical approach:
- deprecate `mining_proxy_sv2` crate
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::common_properties` module
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::proxy_group_channel`
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::job_dispatcher`

this incurred in small adaptations to:
- `pool_sv2`
- `translator_sv2`
- `jd_client`

there were also relatively large adaptations to `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` which stripped it of a lot of functions that were rendered unused

`roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` remains used on  `translator_sv2` (where it will likely be replaced via [#1623](https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/issues/1623)) and `jd_client`

once #1623 is addressed, the only thing preventing deprecation of `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` (#1634) will be its usage on `jd_client`

close #1466 
close #1464

title: Refactor network helpers pass 2
body:
We're still encountering a non-deterministic error on SRI (thanks to @plebhash and @lucasbalieiro for pointing that out), which continues to stem from the network_helpers. My initial suspicion that the issue was due to senders and receivers from network_helpers not being properly dropped during shutdown was only partially correct.

In reality, some structures still hold ownership of the channel endpoints from network_helpers, which prevents tasks from exiting cleanly. This leads to stale loops that persist even after a disconnection or a SIGTERM is received.

This PR explicitly closes all relevant channels on any downstream disconnection or upon receiving a SIGTERM, ensuring a full shutdown of the connection. While this should resolve the immediate issue, we also need to reassess the widespread use of 'static lifetimes throughout the codebase. These overly broad lifetimes are unintentionally prolonging resource ownership beyond necessity, contributing to memory retention and leaks like this.

title: Correct Coinbase Output Length Calculation in `Pool` Role Implementation
body:
closes #1762 

This pull request addresses an issue with the coinbase output length calculation in the `Pool` role.

### Problem:

The code was previously using the length of the `Vec<TxOut>` (number of outputs) to estimate the coinbase output size:

```rust
let coinbase_output_len = coinbase_output_result.len() as u32;
```

However, this approach only reflects the count of outputs, not their actual serialized size, which is critical for accurate calculation.

### Solution:

We now calculate the total serialized size by summing the sizes of individual `TxOut` elements. This aligns with the field’s intended purpose:

> *The maximum additional serialized bytes which the pool will add in coinbase transaction outputs.*

### Logs:

Here are the results with and without the fix:

**With the fix:**
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a15219fb-7b91-4fff-aac7-9e4c10b52593)

**Without the fix:**
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/38a869e3-94ad-43ad-917f-d05c06c06131)

title: run Integration Tests via `cargo nextest`
body:
benefits:

## automatically retry undeterministic tests

SRI has flaky integration tests, which we are ok to live with for now
but if a test fails more than 3 times, it's safe to assume it's failing deterministically
and that's a reliable indication that we shouldn't merge the PR

achieved via `retries = { backoff = "exponential", count = 3, delay = "2s" }`  on `.config/nextest.toml`

## automatically kill hanging tests

if a test runs for 60s, it's marked as `slow`
if it runs for 120s, it's killed

achieved via `slow-timeout = { period = "60s", terminate-after = 2 }` on `.config/nextest.toml`

## isolated test execution

no more logs of different tests mixed together, and most importantly, no mixing of CPU hashpower

achieved via `test-threads = 1` on `.config/nextest.toml`

title: Implements Display for messages across the codebase
body:
**Implements `Display` traits for:**

* Low-level data types, including:

  * `Seq0255`, `Seq064K`, `B016M`, `B064K`, `U256`, etc.

* Protocol messages:

  * Common messages
  * Job declaration
  * Mining
  * Template distribution

* Parsers

Additionally, in roles, replaced `{:?}` in several log entries with `{}` to format parsed byte arrays more clearly.

This change will allow logs to be received in a cleaner, more human-readable format, like this:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2b1e2402-4074-4966-8d66-d9c650f263e1)

Instead of the previous debug format:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/60449241-e378-49d6-8613-50f8fba72f84)

Also, added emojis to some protocol messages for easier identification when reviewing.

There's still plenty of work to do regarding log formatting

title: Simplify network helpers
body: This PR restructures the network_helpers noise_connection flow to make it simpler and more reliable. Previously, we were starting background tasks before completing the handshake, which made the flow confusing and likely caused ghost tasks. Now, the handshake is fully completed first, and only then are the read/write tasks spawned. We also removed the shared state wrapped in sync primitives instead, each stream gets its own cloned state, avoiding unnecessary locking since encryption and decryption are independent in Noise. Overall, this simplifies the architecture, hopefully eliminated zombie task, and makes the flow much easier to reason about.

title: fix unnecessary version bumps
body:
done by mistake on #1728

`job_declaration_sv2` already had MAJOR bumped via #1629 (v3.0.0 to v4.0.0)

`mining_sv2` already had MAJOR bumped via #1651 (v3.0.0 to v4.0.0)

both crates have not yet been published to crates.io, and we were bumping MINOR for both on #1728 

that would have resulted in publishing both crates under v4.1.0, without ever having published v4.0.0

in other words, the changes introduced on #1728 are already covered by the MAJOR bumps that have not yet been published, so no extra MINOR bump is needed

title: update imports in `roles` and `tests` to reflect library reorganization
body:
As discussed in #1740, this PR proposes an alternative solution to close #1458.

All roles have been updated to follow the new import scheme proposed in #1740:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c116410-42b8-4525-87e2-47ac37e45441)

---

### Notes for Reviewers

During the migration to the new import structure, I observed that `stratum-common` was previously used solely to re-export the `bitcoin` and `secp256k1` crates.

With the new structure, however, `roles-logic-sv2` is now a dependency of `stratum-common`. This introduces a circular dependency if `roles-logic-sv2` continues to access the `bitcoin` crate via `stratum-common`.

To break this cycle, I removed the `bitcoin` and `secp256k1` re-exports from `stratum-common`. Any crates that previously relied on those re-exports now import the required crates directly.

---

### Version Bumps

* `stratum-common`: **2.0.0 → 3.0.0**
  Reason: Removed the `bitcoin` feature and introduced new features

* `network-helpers-sv2`: **3.1.0 → 4.0.0**
  Reason: Removed the `binary_Sv2` feature

title: add support for Custom Jobs on `channels::server` APIs
body:
follow up to https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/pull/1672

we found consensus on https://github.com/stratum-mining/sv2-spec/issues/133, however those changes have not been implemented on SRI

this PR is a preparation to migration of JDC to new channel APIs

after that migration, hopefully the changes of https://github.com/stratum-mining/sv2-spec/issues/133 will be easier to implement on SRI

for now, `SetCustomMiningJob.coinbase_tx_value_remaining` is set to 0 on JDC side (more specifically in `channels::server::jobs::extended::ExtendedJob::into_custom_job`) and we assume `SetCustomMiningJob.coinbase_tx_outputs` ALWAYS carries the final serialized outputs (in other words, Pool side will not "fill" any values after receiving the message)

title: Refactor CLI argument parsing with `clap`
body:
closes #1703 
closes #1704 

This pull request refactors the CLI argument parsing across multiple modules to use the [`clap`](https://crates.io/crates/clap) crate. The goal is to improve **maintainability**, **consistency**, and **readability** by replacing custom argument parsing logic with `clap`’s declarative approach.

* Migrated from manual CLI parsing to `clap`-based parsing.
* Reduced redundancy and simplified argument handling across modules.
* Preserved existing command names and default values to ensure backward compatibility.

**Testing:**

* Verified functionality by following the instructions in the [Getting Started guide](https://stratumprotocol.org/getting-started/#ii-getting-started---running-all-roles).
* Confirmed that no CLI APIs were broken as a result of this refactor.

title: Refactor and unification of `CoinbaseOutput` type
body:
Currently there are three `CoinbaseOutput` types: one in protocols/v2/roles-logic-sv2 which I believe is intended to be the "real" type, one in `roles/roles-utils/config-helpers` which I believe is intended to be a mirror of the coinbase outputs specified in the TOML config, and one in `roles/pool` which I believe should've been combined with the second one in #1507 but was missed.

However, both the "real" and "config" types are identical and neither has any invariants enforced on them; they are just a pair of strings. This PR combines these all into one type. In my next PR I will add invariants and make it impossible to construct this type, even from serde, except with a valid coinbase output. I will then extend the type to allow parsing not only the current type/value format, but also a new descriptor format which will cover more usecases and be more compatible with wallets.

This is a first step toward #1652.

title: remove redundant map_err's in translators
body:
Partially Resolves: stratum-mining/sv2-apps#9
This PR is part of an effort to improve error handling in the translator. Currently, there are several redundant .map_err calls in the codebase, which make the code harder to read. This PR removes many of them. However, not all instances could be removed due to the use of non-Send types like MutexGuard errors, which cannot be used in Send contexts (e.g., in tokio::spawn). Addressing these cases will require more targeted changes, which we can defer until we work on those parts of the codebase.

title: `sv1_api`: Setup framework to test IsServer
body:
Add a test server implementation which we can extend to add other tests.

It would be more ergonomic to use mockall, however the lifetime param in IsServer makes it more complicated to use things like mockall. So for now, I propose we use the TestServer approach to write tests for IsServer trait's default implementations.


It might seem we have too much code for a small test, but we'll be reusing all that TestServer block of code for testing a fair few of the IsServer functions.

title: Reintroduce TProxy-JD integration test
body:
Partially addresses #1574 

This was tested on MacOS with M1 and Linux with AMD using the following script without encountering any failures.

```sh
#!/bin/bash

command_to_run="cargo test --test 'jd_tproxy_integration' -- --nocapture"

num_runs=20
success_count=0
fail_count=0

for i in $(seq 1 "$num_runs"); do
  echo "Running command $i of $num_runs..."
  if eval "$command_to_run"; then
    echo "Run $i: Success"
    ((success_count++))
  else
    echo "Run $i: Fail"
    ((fail_count++))
  fi
done

echo "-------------------------"
echo "Total Runs: $num_runs"
echo "Successful Runs: $success_count"
echo "Failed Runs: $fail_count"
echo "-------------------------"
```

title: `routing_logic` and `selectors` refactoring
body:
This PR is built on top of #1567.

It mainly removes `routing_logic` and `selectors` modules from `roles-logic-sv2`, given that the only real usage was done by the mining-proxy.

They are now inside mining-proxy, so that we can simplify a lot both handlers, common-properties, and other roles.

Closes #1446 #1447

title: trying to unblock CI
body:
we're constantly getting `wait_for_message_type` timeouts on Integration Tests running on CI

while we need to find the root cause of these timeouts, waiting for 10 minutes is becoming a big bottleneck

title: rm `jds-setupconnection-with-async-support` and `jds-setupconnection-without-async-support` MG tests
body:
close #1570

interestingly, it seems we forgot to list them under `mg.yaml`, so this PR does not touch that file

title: Handlers refactoring
body:
This PR refactors `handlers` inside `roles_logic_sv2` crate.

Closes #1443

title: remove `translator-proxy-old-share` and revert #910
body: close #1560

title: Let JDC continue listening to the downstream port but serve only a single client.
body: Addresses: #1543

title: add tracing to all IT test
body: closes: #1544

title: move IT out of roles workspace
body:
Closes: #1514

This PR removes IT from the roles workspace and updates the CI accordingly.

title: add tracing to `Sniffer`
body:
close #1552

example run of `test_sniffer_intercept_to_upstream` (with other tracing logs manually filtered out):
```
2025-03-11T00:37:39.785195Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer B | Forwarded: SetupConnection | Direction: ⬆
2025-03-11T00:37:39.790740Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer A | Replaced: SetupConnection with SetupConnection | Direction: ⬆
...
2025-03-11T00:37:39.794111Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer A | Forwarded: SetupConnectionSuccess | Direction: ⬇
...
2025-03-11T00:37:39.794217Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer B | Forwarded: SetupConnectionSuccess | Direction: ⬇
...
2025-03-11T00:37:39.795156Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer B | Forwarded: CoinbaseOutputDataSize | Direction: ⬆
...
2025-03-11T00:37:39.795244Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer A | Forwarded: CoinbaseOutputDataSize | Direction: ⬆
```

and `test_sniffer_blocks_message`:
```
2025-03-11T00:36:50.529739Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer C | Forwarded: SetupConnection | Direction: ⬆
2025-03-11T00:36:50.532544Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer B | Forwarded: SetupConnection | Direction: ⬆
2025-03-11T00:36:50.539832Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer A | Forwarded: SetupConnection | Direction: ⬆
...
2025-03-11T00:36:50.540278Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer A | Forwarded: SetupConnectionSuccess | Direction: ⬇
...
2025-03-11T00:36:50.540366Z  INFO integration_tests_sv2::sniffer: 🔍 Sniffer B | Ignored: SetupConnectionSuccess | Direction: ⬇
```
